TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RangeValuePattern extends System.Windows.Automation.BasePattern

Docs.summary: Represents a control that can be set to a value within a range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Controls may allow recalibration of their supported properties based upon locale or user preference. An example of this would be a thermometer control that can be set to display the temperature in Fahrenheit or Celsius.

Docs.related: UI Automation Control Patterns for Clients
Implementing the UI Automation RangeValue Control Pattern

Docs.summary: Gets the cached property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>. To get the value of a property at the current point in time, get the property by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.Current%2A>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation>.

Docs.exception: The requested property is not in the cache.
Docs.related: UI Automation Control Patterns for Clients
Implementing the UI Automation RangeValue Control Pattern

Docs.summary: Gets the current property values for this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.Full> reference in order to get current values. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.None>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception. Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation>.

Docs.related: UI Automation Control Patterns for Clients
Implementing the UI Automation RangeValue Control Pattern

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
## Examples In the following example, a root element is passed to a function that returns a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>s that are descendants of the root and satisfy a set of property conditions.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Pattern As AutomationPattern

remarks.format:
## Remarks This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications. UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePatternIdentifiers>.
The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
[!code-csharp[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.vb#101)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetValue(float64 value) cil managed

Docs.param: The new value of the element.
Docs.summary: Sets the value associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The actual value set depends on the control implementation. The control might round the requested `value` up or down. A UI Automation client can examine the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.RangeValuePatternInformation.Value%2A> property to determine the actual updated value. The client can also register for a property-changed event on the property and examine the old and new values returned in the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs>.
## Examples In the following example, an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> that supports the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern> control pattern has its value set to the control-specific minimum value.
[!code-csharp[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#104Minimum](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.cs#104minimum)] [!code-vb[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#104Minimum](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.vb#104minimum)] [!code-csharp[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#104](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.cs#104)] [!code-vb[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#104](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.vb#104)] [!code-csharp[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.cs#101)] [!code-vb[UIARangeValuePattern_snip#101](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIARangeValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIARangeValuePattern_snippets.vb#101)]

Docs.exception: is less than the minimum or greater than the maximum value of the element.
